//notes: vomiting is one of the possible side effects
noted to increase likelihood of headaches
description: A popular extended-spectrum antibiotic in the form of an oval tablet.  On one side,  "AUGMENTIN" is imprinted; on the other, "500 / 125", indicating the dosage of its two main components: amoxicillin and clavulanic acid.  Has a moderate effect on bacterial infections.  One dose lasts 12 hours.

//notes: nitazoxanide would be the broad-spectrum equivalent, having an effect on a wide variety of parasites
known to cause nausea and headaches as side effects
description: A potent broad-spectrum antihelmintic (antiparasitic with a focus on worms and larvae) in the form of a white tablet.  On one side of the tablet, "V 32" is etched.  Originally designed for use in animals, it had been approved for humans soon after.
//variants: also sold under the trade name Albenza
//container: sold as two tablets per bottle
likely to be a large bottle due to the listed weight of 0.035 lbs = 15.876 g
